@@ -0,0 +1,211 @@
+# Gold Pan & Ore Washer Implementation
+
+## Summary of Changes
+
+This implementation completes the renaming and restructuring of the Auto Panning Machine into two separate multiblocks and adds a Gold Pan tool.
+
+---
+
+## 1. **Ore Washer** (Renamed from Auto Panning Machine)
+**Purpose**: Convert Sifted Ore Dust → Random Metal Dusts
+
+### Structure
+```
+[Dispenser]  ← Player interacts here
+[Fence]      ← Any type of fence
+[Cauldron]   ← Bottom
+```
+
+### Files
+- **Recipe**: `recipes/workstations/multiblocks/OreWasher.java`
+- **Functionality**: `workstations/multiblocks/OreWasherMachine.java`
+- **Crafting**: Basic Workbench (shows structure diagram)
+
+### Recipe
+- Input: Sifted Ore Dust
+- Output: Random Metal Dusts (Iron, Copper, Gold, Tin, Silver, Aluminum, Lead, Zinc, Magnesium)
+
+---
+
+## 2. **Automated Panning Machine** (New)
+**Purpose**: Convert Gravel → Sifted Ore Dust
+
+### Structure
+```
+[Trapdoor]   ← Any type of trapdoor
+[Cauldron]   ← Player interacts here
+```
+
+### Files
+- **Recipe**: `recipes/workstations/multiblocks/AutomatedPanningMachine.java`
+- **Functionality**: `workstations/multiblocks/AutomatedPanningMachineMachine.java`
+- **Crafting**: Basic Workbench (shows structure diagram)
+
+### Recipe
+- Input: Gravel
+- Output: Sifted Ore Dust (1:1 ratio)
+
+### Implementation Details
+- Uses custom inventory with 9 slots
+- Stores cauldron location in custom `AutomatedPanningInventoryHolder`
+- Outputs to adjacent chest or drops on ground if no chest available
+
+---
+
+## 3. **Gold Pan** (New Tool)
+**Purpose**: Manual tool for panning gravel into resources
+
+### Recipe
+```
+[Stone] [Bowl]  [Stone]
+[Stone] [Stone] [Stone]
+```
+
+### Crafting
+- Crafted at: Basic Workbench
+- Result: 1x Gold Pan
+
+### Functionality
+Right-click on gravel blocks while holding Gold Pan to get random outputs:
+- 40% chance: Iron Nugget
+- 35% chance: Sifted Ore Dust
+- 15% chance: Clay Ball
+- 10% chance: Flint
+
+### Files
+- **Recipe**: `recipes/tools/GoldPan.java`
+- **Handler**: `listeners/ToolListener.java` (new)
+
+### How It Works
+1. Player right-clicks gravel while holding Gold Pan
+2. Random item drops at the gravel location
+3. The gravel block is removed
+4. Tool has no cooldown (instant use)
+
+---
+
+## 4. **System Integration**
+
+### Event Listeners
+Updated `listeners/MultiblockListener.java` to handle:
+- Ore Washer (dispenser on fence on cauldron)
+- Automated Panning Machine (trapdoor on cauldron)
+
+Created new `listeners/ToolListener.java` for:
+- Gold Pan right-click on gravel
+
+### Plugin Registration
+Updated `TechFactory.java` to register ToolListener on plugin startup.
+
+---
+
+## 5. **Backward Compatibility**
+
+### Auto Panning Machine (Legacy)
+The original Auto Panning Machine still exists but is kept only for backward compatibility with existing worlds. It is NOT the primary implementation anymore.
+
+- Still exists in codebase for worlds that have it built
+- New builds should use **Ore Washer** + **Automated Panning Machine** instead
+- Both machines have same structure (Dispenser/Fence/Cauldron)
+
+---
+
+## 6. **Crafting Recipes Summary**
+
+### Gold Pan
+```
+Material: Stone Bowl
+Text: "A tool for panning gravel"
+Crafting Pattern:
+  Stone | Bowl  | Stone
+  Stone | Stone | Stone
+Crafted at: Basic Workbench
+```
+
+### Ore Washer (Structure)
+```
+Material: Cauldron  
+Text: "A multiblock machine for washing ore dust"
+Pattern:
+  [empty] | Dispenser | [empty]
+  [empty] | Fence     | [empty]
+  [empty] | Cauldron  | [empty]
+Built In-Game
+```
+
+### Automated Panning Machine (Structure)
+```
+Material: Cauldron
+Text: "Automated version of the Gold Pan"
+Pattern:
+  [empty] | Trapdoor | [empty]
+  [empty] | Cauldron | [empty]
+Built In-Game
+```
+
+---
+
+## 7. **Usage Flow**
+
+### Getting Sifted Ore Dust
+**Option A - Manual (Quick)**
+1. Hold Gold Pan
+2. Right-click gravel
+3. Get random resource (40% chance for Sifted Ore Dust)
+
+**Option B - Automated Panning Machine (Reliable)**
+1. Build multiblock: Trapdoor on Cauldron
+2. Right-click cauldron
+3. Place gravel in inventory
+4. Close inventory
+5. Get Sifted Ore Dust (100% conversion)
+
+### Converting Sifted Ore Dust to Metal Dusts
+1. Build Ore Washer: Dispenser on Fence on Cauldron
+2. Right-click dispenser
+3. Place Sifted Ore Dust
+4. Close inventory
+5. Get random metal dusts
+
+---
+
+## 8. **Testing Checklist**
+
+- [ ] Gold Pan crafts correctly at Basic Workbench
+- [ ] Gold Pan right-click on gravel works and drops items
+- [ ] Automated Panning Machine structure validates correctly
+- [ ] Automated Panning Machine opens inventory correctly
+- [ ] Automated Panning Machine converts gravel to sifted ore dust
+- [ ] Ore Washer structure validates correctly
+- [ ] Ore Washer opens inventory correctly
+- [ ] Ore Washer converts sifted ore dust to metal dusts
+- [ ] Output to adjacent chest works for both machines
+- [ ] Items drop on ground if no chest available
+
+---
+
+## 9. **Files Modified/Created**
+
+### Created
+- `listeners/ToolListener.java` - New tool event handler
+- `workstations/multiblocks/AutomatedPanningMachineMachine.java` - New (already created by assistant)
+- `recipes/workstations/multiblocks/AutomatedPanningMachine.java` - New (already created by assistant)
+- `workstations/multiblocks/OreWasherMachine.java` - Renamed/refactored (already created by assistant)
+- `recipes/workstations/multiblocks/OreWasher.java` - Renamed (already created by assistant)
+- `recipes/tools/GoldPan.java` - New tool (already created by assistant)
+
+### Modified
+- `listeners/MultiblockListener.java` - Added handlers for new multiblocks
+- `TechFactory.java` - Registered ToolListener
+
+---
+
+## 10. **Notes**
+
+1. **Item ID Validation**: All custom items use NBT data for validation (PersistentDataContainer) to prevent players from faking items with anvil renames.
+
+2. **Inventory Tracking**: AutomatedPanningMachine uses a custom InventoryHolder to properly track which cauldron the player opened.
+
+3. **Output Flexibility**: Both multiblocks prefer to output to adjacent chests but will fall back to dropping items on the ground or storing in the machine if no chest is available.
+
+4. **Performance**: No significant performance impact - all operations are instant (no async tasks).

+# Gold Pan & Ore Processing - Quick Start Guide
+
+## Overview
+TechFactory now has THREE ways to process gravel and ore dust:
+1. **Gold Pan** - Manual tool (quick, random outputs)
+2. **Automated Panning Machine** - Multiblock (reliable, consistent)
+3. **Ore Washer** - Multiblock (converts dust to metals)
+
+---
+
+## 🛠️ Gold Pan (Tool)
+
+### Crafting
+```
+At: Basic Workbench
+Recipe:
+  Stone    | Bowl     | Stone
+  Stone    | Stone    | Stone
+Output: 1x Gold Pan
+```
+
+### How to Use
+1. Hold the Gold Pan in your hand
+2. Right-click on any gravel block
+3. Random item drops and gravel disappears
+
+### Outputs (Random)
+- **40%** Iron Nugget
+- **35%** Sifted Ore Dust ← Most useful!
+- **15%** Clay Ball
+- **10%** Flint
+
+### Pros & Cons
+✅ No building required - instant use
+✅ Can carry multiple
+✅ Uses gravel (renewable)
+❌ Random outputs - only 35% chance for ore dust
+❌ Manual - one at a time
+
+---
+
+## ⚙️ Automated Panning Machine (Multiblock)
+
+### Structure
+Build this shape:
+```
+    [Trapdoor]
+    [Cauldron]
+```
+
+Use ANY type of trapdoor (Oak, Spruce, Iron, etc.)
+
+### Recipe
+First, craft at Basic Workbench - shows structure diagram
+
+### How to Use
+1. Right-click the **Cauldron** to open inventory
+2. Place gravel in the inventory  
+3. Close the inventory
+4. Gravel → Sifted Ore Dust (1:1 ratio)
+5. Output goes to adjacent chest or drops on ground
+
+### Pros & Cons
+✅ 100% reliable - all gravel becomes dust
+✅ Automatic processing
+✅ Can place chest next to it for auto-collection
+❌ Requires building
+❌ Can only process gravel (not other items)
+
+---
+
+## 💧 Ore Washer (Multiblock)
+
+### Structure
+Build this shape:
+```
+    [Dispenser]
+    [Fence]
+    [Cauldron]
+```
+
+Use ANY type of fence and ANY type of trapdoor
+
+### Recipe
+First, craft at Basic Workbench - shows structure diagram
+
+### How to Use
+1. Right-click the **Dispenser** to open inventory
+2. Place Sifted Ore Dust in the inventory
+3. Close the inventory
+4. Dust → Random Metal Dusts
+5. Output goes to adjacent chest or drops on ground
+
+### Outputs (Random Metal Dusts)
+- Iron Dust
+- Copper Dust
+- Gold Dust
+- Tin Dust
+- Silver Dust
+- Aluminum Dust
+- Lead Dust
+- Zinc Dust
+- Magnesium Dust
+
+### Pros & Cons
+✅ High-yield - each dust gets converted
+✅ Automatic processing
+✅ Can chain with Automated Panning Machine
+❌ Requires building
+
+---
+
+## 📊 Processing Chain
+
+### Method 1: Manual (Slow)
+```
+Gravel → (Gold Pan) → Random Items
+                   ↓ (35% chance)
+              Sifted Ore Dust
+```
+
+### Method 2: Automated (Best for large scale)
+```
+Gravel → [Automated Panning Machine] → Sifted Ore Dust
+                                             ↓
+                                      [Ore Washer]
+                                             ↓
+                                      Metal Dusts
+```
+
+### Recommended Setup
+```
+    [Chest] ← outputs ore dust
+       ↑
+[Automated Panning Machine]
+       ↑
+Gravel hopper input
+
+    [Chest] ← outputs dusts
+       ↑
+    [Ore Washer]
+       ↑
+Dust hopper input
+```
+
+---
+
+## 📝 Useful Tips
+
+1. **Chest Placement**
+   - Place a chest touching any part of the multiblock
+   - Output will go to the chest instead of ground
+   - Perfect for auto-sorting systems
+
+2. **Gold Pan Efficiency**
+   - Use when you need quick items early game
+   - Combine with Automated Panning Machine later
+   - Iron Nuggets are useful for crafting
+
+3. **Scaling**
+   - Build multiple Automated Panning Machines for faster processing
+   - Use hoppers on top for automatic input
+   - Use droppers for timed feeding
+
+4. **Item Storage**
+   - NBT-tagged items - can't fake with anvils
+   - Store in chests or hoppers normally
+   - Works with Shulker boxes
+
+---
+
+## ⚡ Next Steps
+
+After processing ore dust:
+1. Use Ore Washer to get metal dusts
+2. Smelt at a Smelter (grind dustto get metals)
+3. Craft into ingots and tools
+4. Build industrial machines
+
+---
+
+## 🐛 Troubleshooting
+
+**Gold Pan doesn't work?**
+- Make sure you're holding it in your main hand
+- Right-click ON gravel, not air
+- Check that the gravel is fully loaded (not underground chunks)
+
+**Multiblocks not working?**
+- Check structure exactly - blocks must be in perfect alignment
+- Try breaking and rebuilding
+- Make sure you're clicking the right block (see "How to Use")
+
+**Items not outputting to chest?**
+- Chest must be adjacent (touching sides)
+- Try different sides/directions
+- Items will drop on ground if no chest available
+
+---
+
+## 📚 Related Items
+
+- **Sifted Ore Dust** - Made by Automated Panning Machine
+- **Metal Dusts** - Made by Ore Washer (Iron, Copper, Gold, etc.)
+- **Metal Ingots** - Made by Smelter from dusts
+- **Ore Blocks** - Mined with pickaxe for raw materials
+
+---
+

+**Version:** TechFactory with Gold Pan System

+package org.ThefryGuy.techFactory.listeners;%0D%0A%0D%0Aimport org.bukkit.ChatColor;%0D%0Aimport org.bukkit.Material;%0D%0Aimport org.bukkit.block.Block;%0D%0Aimport org.bukkit.entity.Player;%0D%0Aimport org.bukkit.event.EventHandler;%0D%0Aimport org.bukkit.event.Listener;%0D%0Aimport org.bukkit.event.block.Action;%0D%0Aimport org.bukkit.event.player.PlayerInteractEvent;%0D%0Aimport org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack;%0D%0Aimport org.ThefryGuy.techFactory.recipes.RecipeItem;%0D%0Aimport org.ThefryGuy.techFactory.recipes.dusts.SiftedOreDust;%0D%0A%0D%0Aimport java.util.Random;%0D%0A%0D%0A/**%0D%0A * Listener for tool interactions.%0D%0A * %0D%0A * Handles:%0D%0A * - Gold Pan right-click on gravel%0D%0A */%0D%0Apublic class ToolListener implements Listener %7B%0D%0A%0D%0A    private static final Random random = new Random();%0D%0A%0D%0A    /**%0D%0A     * Handle player right-clicking with tools.%0D%0A     */%0D%0A    @EventHandler%0D%0A    public void onPlayerInteract(PlayerInteractEvent event) %7B%0D%0A        // Only care about right-clicks on blocks%0D%0A        if (event.getAction() != Action.RIGHT_CLICK_BLOCK) %7B%0D%0A            return;%0D%0A        %7D%0D%0A%0D%0A        Player player = event.getPlayer();%0D%0A        ItemStack itemInHand = player.getInventory().getItemInMainHand();%0D%0A%0D%0A        // Check if player is holding a Gold Pan%0D%0A        if (itemInHand != null && RecipeItem.isValidItem(itemInHand, %22gold_pan%22)) %7B%0D%0A            Block clickedBlock = event.getClickedBlock();%0D%0A            if (clickedBlock != null && clickedBlock.getType() == Material.GRAVEL) %7B%0D%0A                event.setCancelled(true);%0D%0A                processGoldPan(player, clickedBlock);%0D%0A                return;%0D%0A            %7D%0D%0A        %7D%0D%0A    %7D%0D%0A%0D%0A    /**%0D%0A     * Process the Gold Pan on gravel.%0D%0A     * Random outputs from the table.%0D%0A     * %0D%0A     * @param player The player using the pan%0D%0A     * @param gravelBlock The gravel block being panned%0D%0A     */%0D%0A    private void processGoldPan(Player player, Block gravelBlock) %7B%0D%0A        // Randomly choose what the player gets%0D%0A        int roll = random.nextInt(100);%0D%0A%0D%0A        ItemStack result;%0D%0A%0D%0A        if (roll %3C 40) %7B%0D%0A            // 40%25 chance: Iron Nugget%0D%0A            result = new ItemStack(Material.IRON_NUGGET);%0D%0A            player.sendMessage(ChatColor.GOLD + %22You panned out an %22 + ChatColor.WHITE + %22Iron Nugget!%22);%0D%0A        %7D else if (roll %3C 75) %7B%0D%0A            // 35%25 chance: Sifted Ore Dust%0D%0A            SiftedOreDust dust = new SiftedOreDust();%0D%0A            result = dust.getItemStack();%0D%0A            player.sendMessage(ChatColor.GOLD + %22You panned out %22 + ChatColor.WHITE + %22Sifted Ore Dust!%22);%0D%0A        %7D else if (roll %3C 90) %7B%0D%0A            // 15%25 chance: Clay Ball%0D%0A            result = new ItemStack(Material.CLAY_BALL);%0D%0A            player.sendMessage(ChatColor.GOLD + %22You panned out a %22 + ChatColor.WHITE + %22Clay Ball!%22);%0D%0A        %7D else %7B%0D%0A            // 10%25 chance: Flint%0D%0A            result = new ItemStack(Material.FLINT);%0D%0A            player.sendMessage(ChatColor.GOLD + %22You panned out %22 + ChatColor.WHITE + %22Flint!%22);%0D%0A        %7D%0D%0A%0D%0A        // Drop the item at the gravel block location%0D%0A        gravelBlock.getWorld().dropItem(gravelBlock.getLocation().add(0.5, 1, 0.5), result);%0D%0A%0D%0A        // Remove one gravel from the block (if it has multiple)%0D%0A        if (gravelBlock.getType() == Material.GRAVEL) %7B%0D%0A            // In Minecraft, gravel blocks are single blocks, so we just remove it%0D%0A            // If the block is part of a larger gravel area, we remove it%0D%0A            gravelBlock.setType(Material.AIR);%0D%0A        %7D%0D%0A%0D%0A        // Add slight cooldown message%0D%0A        player.sendMessage(ChatColor.GRAY + %22Ready to pan again!%22);%0D%0A    %7D%0D%0A%7D

+# Gold Pan & Ore Washer Implementation%0D%0A%0D%0A## Summary of Changes%0D%0A%0D%0AThis implementation completes the renaming and restructuring of the Auto Panning Machine into two separate multiblocks and adds a Gold Pan tool.%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## 1. **Ore Washer** (Renamed from Auto Panning Machine)%0D%0A**Purpose**: Convert Sifted Ore Dust %E2%86%92 Random Metal Dusts%0D%0A%0D%0A### Structure%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%5BDispenser%5D  %E2%86%90 Player interacts here%0D%0A%5BFence%5D      %E2%86%90 Any type of fence%0D%0A%5BCauldron%5D   %E2%86%90 Bottom%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A### Files%0D%0A- **Recipe**: %60recipes/workstations/multiblocks/OreWasher.java%60%0D%0A- **Functionality**: %60workstations/multiblocks/OreWasherMachine.java%60%0D%0A- **Crafting**: Basic Workbench (shows structure diagram)%0D%0A%0D%0A### Recipe%0D%0A- Input: Sifted Ore Dust%0D%0A- Output: Random Metal Dusts (Iron, Copper, Gold, Tin, Silver, Aluminum, Lead, Zinc, Magnesium)%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## 2. **Automated Panning Machine** (New)%0D%0A**Purpose**: Convert Gravel %E2%86%92 Sifted Ore Dust%0D%0A%0D%0A### Structure%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%5BTrapdoor%5D   %E2%86%90 Any type of trapdoor%0D%0A%5BCauldron%5D   %E2%86%90 Player interacts here%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A### Files%0D%0A- **Recipe**: %60recipes/workstations/multiblocks/AutomatedPanningMachine.java%60%0D%0A- **Functionality**: %60workstations/multiblocks/AutomatedPanningMachineMachine.java%60%0D%0A- **Crafting**: Basic Workbench (shows structure diagram)%0D%0A%0D%0A### Recipe%0D%0A- Input: Gravel%0D%0A- Output: Sifted Ore Dust (1:1 ratio)%0D%0A%0D%0A### Implementation Details%0D%0A- Uses custom inventory with 9 slots%0D%0A- Stores cauldron location in custom %60AutomatedPanningInventoryHolder%60%0D%0A- Outputs to adjacent chest or drops on ground if no chest available%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## 3. **Gold Pan** (New Tool)%0D%0A**Purpose**: Manual tool for panning gravel into resources%0D%0A%0D%0A### Recipe%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%5BStone%5D %5BBowl%5D  %5BStone%5D%0D%0A%5BStone%5D %5BStone%5D %5BStone%5D%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A### Crafting%0D%0A- Crafted at: Basic Workbench%0D%0A- Result: 1x Gold Pan%0D%0A%0D%0A### Functionality%0D%0ARight-click on gravel blocks while holding Gold Pan to get random outputs:%0D%0A- 40%25 chance: Iron Nugget%0D%0A- 35%25 chance: Sifted Ore Dust%0D%0A- 15%25 chance: Clay Ball%0D%0A- 10%25 chance: Flint%0D%0A%0D%0A### Files%0D%0A- **Recipe**: %60recipes/tools/GoldPan.java%60%0D%0A- **Handler**: %60listeners/ToolListener.java%60 (new)%0D%0A%0D%0A### How It Works%0D%0A1. Player right-clicks gravel while holding Gold Pan%0D%0A2. Random item drops at the gravel location%0D%0A3. The gravel block is removed%0D%0A4. Tool has no cooldown (instant use)%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## 4. **System Integration**%0D%0A%0D%0A### Event Listeners%0D%0AUpdated %60listeners/MultiblockListener.java%60 to handle:%0D%0A- Ore Washer (dispenser on fence on cauldron)%0D%0A- Automated Panning Machine (trapdoor on cauldron)%0D%0A%0D%0ACreated new %60listeners/ToolListener.java%60 for:%0D%0A- Gold Pan right-click on gravel%0D%0A%0D%0A### Plugin Registration%0D%0AUpdated %60TechFactory.java%60 to register ToolListener on plugin startup.%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## 5. **Backward Compatibility**%0D%0A%0D%0A### Auto Panning Machine (Legacy)%0D%0AThe original Auto Panning Machine still exists but is kept only for backward compatibility with existing worlds. It is NOT the primary implementation anymore.%0D%0A%0D%0A- Still exists in codebase for worlds that have it built%0D%0A- New builds should use **Ore Washer** + **Automated Panning Machine** instead%0D%0A- Both machines have same structure (Dispenser/Fence/Cauldron)%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## 6. **Crafting Recipes Summary**%0D%0A%0D%0A### Gold Pan%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0AMaterial: Stone Bowl%0D%0AText: %22A tool for panning gravel%22%0D%0ACrafting Pattern:%0D%0A  Stone %7C Bowl  %7C Stone%0D%0A  Stone %7C Stone %7C Stone%0D%0ACrafted at: Basic Workbench%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A### Ore Washer (Structure)%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0AMaterial: Cauldron  %0D%0AText: %22A multiblock machine for washing ore dust%22%0D%0APattern:%0D%0A  %5Bempty%5D %7C Dispenser %7C %5Bempty%5D%0D%0A  %5Bempty%5D %7C Fence     %7C %5Bempty%5D%0D%0A  %5Bempty%5D %7C Cauldron  %7C %5Bempty%5D%0D%0ABuilt In-Game%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A### Automated Panning Machine (Structure)%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0AMaterial: Cauldron%0D%0AText: %22Automated version of the Gold Pan%22%0D%0APattern:%0D%0A  %5Bempty%5D %7C Trapdoor %7C %5Bempty%5D%0D%0A  %5Bempty%5D %7C Cauldron %7C %5Bempty%5D%0D%0ABuilt In-Game%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## 7. **Usage Flow**%0D%0A%0D%0A### Getting Sifted Ore Dust%0D%0A**Option A - Manual (Quick)**%0D%0A1. Hold Gold Pan%0D%0A2. Right-click gravel%0D%0A3. Get random resource (40%25 chance for Sifted Ore Dust)%0D%0A%0D%0A**Option B - Automated Panning Machine (Reliable)**%0D%0A1. Build multiblock: Trapdoor on Cauldron%0D%0A2. Right-click cauldron%0D%0A3. Place gravel in inventory%0D%0A4. Close inventory%0D%0A5. Get Sifted Ore Dust (100%25 conversion)%0D%0A%0D%0A### Converting Sifted Ore Dust to Metal Dusts%0D%0A1. Build Ore Washer: Dispenser on Fence on Cauldron%0D%0A2. Right-click dispenser%0D%0A3. Place Sifted Ore Dust%0D%0A4. Close inventory%0D%0A5. Get random metal dusts%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## 8. **Testing Checklist**%0D%0A%0D%0A- %5B %5D Gold Pan crafts correctly at Basic Workbench%0D%0A- %5B %5D Gold Pan right-click on gravel works and drops items%0D%0A- %5B %5D Automated Panning Machine structure validates correctly%0D%0A- %5B %5D Automated Panning Machine opens inventory correctly%0D%0A- %5B %5D Automated Panning Machine converts gravel to sifted ore dust%0D%0A- %5B %5D Ore Washer structure validates correctly%0D%0A- %5B %5D Ore Washer opens inventory correctly%0D%0A- %5B %5D Ore Washer converts sifted ore dust to metal dusts%0D%0A- %5B %5D Output to adjacent chest works for both machines%0D%0A- %5B %5D Items drop on ground if no chest available%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## 9. **Files Modified/Created**%0D%0A%0D%0A### Created%0D%0A- %60listeners/ToolListener.java%60 - New tool event handler%0D%0A- %60workstations/multiblocks/AutomatedPanningMachineMachine.java%60 - New (already created by assistant)%0D%0A- %60recipes/workstations/multiblocks/AutomatedPanningMachine.java%60 - New (already created by assistant)%0D%0A- %60workstations/multiblocks/OreWasherMachine.java%60 - Renamed/refactored (already created by assistant)%0D%0A- %60recipes/workstations/multiblocks/OreWasher.java%60 - Renamed (already created by assistant)%0D%0A- %60recipes/tools/GoldPan.java%60 - New tool (already created by assistant)%0D%0A%0D%0A### Modified%0D%0A- %60listeners/MultiblockListener.java%60 - Added handlers for new multiblocks%0D%0A- %60TechFactory.java%60 - Registered ToolListener%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## 10. **Notes**%0D%0A%0D%0A1. **Item ID Validation**: All custom items use NBT data for validation (PersistentDataContainer) to prevent players from faking items with anvil renames.%0D%0A%0D%0A2. **Inventory Tracking**: AutomatedPanningMachine uses a custom InventoryHolder to properly track which cauldron the player opened.%0D%0A%0D%0A3. **Output Flexibility**: Both multiblocks prefer to output to adjacent chests but will fall back to dropping items on the ground or storing in the machine if no chest is available.%0D%0A%0D%0A4. **Performance**: No significant performance impact - all operations are instant (no async tasks).

+# Gold Pan & Ore Processing - Quick Start Guide%0D%0A%0D%0A## Overview%0D%0ATechFactory now has THREE ways to process gravel and ore dust:%0D%0A1. **Gold Pan** - Manual tool (quick, random outputs)%0D%0A2. **Automated Panning Machine** - Multiblock (reliable, consistent)%0D%0A3. **Ore Washer** - Multiblock (converts dust to metals)%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## %F0%9F%9B%A0%EF%B8%8F Gold Pan (Tool)%0D%0A%0D%0A### Crafting%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0AAt: Basic Workbench%0D%0ARecipe:%0D%0A  Stone    %7C Bowl     %7C Stone%0D%0A  Stone    %7C Stone    %7C Stone%0D%0AOutput: 1x Gold Pan%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0A### How to Use%0D%0A1. Hold the Gold Pan in your hand%0D%0A2. Right-click on any gravel block%0D%0A3. Random item drops and gravel disappears%0D%0A%0D%0A### Outputs (Random)%0D%0A- **40%25** Iron Nugget%0D%0A- **35%25** Sifted Ore Dust %E2%86%90 Most useful!%0D%0A- **15%25** Clay Ball%0D%0A- **10%25** Flint%0D%0A%0D%0A### Pros & Cons%0D%0A%E2%9C%85 No building required - instant use%0D%0A%E2%9C%85 Can carry multiple%0D%0A%E2%9C%85 Uses gravel (renewable)%0D%0A%E2%9D%8C Random outputs - only 35%25 chance for ore dust%0D%0A%E2%9D%8C Manual - one at a time%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## %E2%9A%99%EF%B8%8F Automated Panning Machine (Multiblock)%0D%0A%0D%0A### Structure%0D%0ABuild this shape:%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A    %5BTrapdoor%5D%0D%0A    %5BCauldron%5D%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0AUse ANY type of trapdoor (Oak, Spruce, Iron, etc.)%0D%0A%0D%0A### Recipe%0D%0AFirst, craft at Basic Workbench - shows structure diagram%0D%0A%0D%0A### How to Use%0D%0A1. Right-click the **Cauldron** to open inventory%0D%0A2. Place gravel in the inventory  %0D%0A3. Close the inventory%0D%0A4. Gravel %E2%86%92 Sifted Ore Dust (1:1 ratio)%0D%0A5. Output goes to adjacent chest or drops on ground%0D%0A%0D%0A### Pros & Cons%0D%0A%E2%9C%85 100%25 reliable - all gravel becomes dust%0D%0A%E2%9C%85 Automatic processing%0D%0A%E2%9C%85 Can place chest next to it for auto-collection%0D%0A%E2%9D%8C Requires building%0D%0A%E2%9D%8C Can only process gravel (not other items)%0D%0A%0D%0A---%0D%0A%0D%0A## %F0%9F%92%A7 Ore Washer (Multiblock)%0D%0A%0D%0A### Structure%0D%0ABuild this shape:%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A    %5BDispenser%5D%0D%0A    %5BFence%5D%0D%0A    %5BCauldron%5D%0D%0A%60%60%60%0D%0A%0D%0AUse ANY type of fence and ANY type of trapdoor%0D%0A%0D%0A### Recipe%0D%0AFirst, craft at Basic Workbench - shows structure diagram%0D%0A%0D%0A### How to Use%0D%0A1. Right-click the **Dispenser** to open inventory%0D%0A2. Place Sifted Ore Dust in the inventory%0D%0A3. Close the inventory%0D%0A4. Dust %E2%86%92 Random Metal Dusts%0D%0A5. Output goes to adjacent chest or drops on ground%0D%0A%0D%0A### Outputs (Random Metal Dusts)%0D%0A- Iron Dust%0D%0A- Copper Dust%0D%0A- Gold Dust%0D%0A- Tin Dust%0D%0A- Silver Dust%0D%0A- Aluminum Dust%0D%0A- Lead Dust%0D%0A- Zinc Dust%0D%0A- Magnesium Dust%0D%0A%0D%0A### Pros & Cons%0D%0A%E2%9C%85 High-yield -
